english: Reward Regulations for the Employment of Indigenous People by Free Trade Zone Enterprises
title: 自由貿易港區事業僱用原住民獎勵辦法
history: Council of Indigenous Peoples, Executive Yuan Order Yuan-Min-Wei No. 0990035275 dated July 5, 2010

articles.content: These Regulations are been pursuant to Paragraph 4, Article 11 of the Act for the Establishment and Management of Free Trade Zones (hereinafter referred to as FTZs).

Business enterprises in a Free Trade Zone (FTZ) to which these Regulations are applicable refer to those whose number of indigenous employees exceeds the quota that applies to members of the indigenous communities as stipulated in Paragraph 2 of Article 11 of the Act. However, for enterprises operating in the FTZ of an international airport, the relevant regulations shall prevail.
Aforementioned members of indigenous communities refer to individuals who are recognized as such in accordance with the provisions of the Status Act for Indigenous Peoples.

Pursuant to Paragraph 2, Article 11 of the Act, when calculating the number of employees with indigenous status, the decimal places are excluded.
The aforementioned number of workers refers to the number of workers participating in Labor Insurance and actually working in the FTZ on a daily basis, as recorded on the first day of each month.

The following awards shall be presented to eligible recipients:
1. Outstanding Award: Businesses that have employed an additional five or more workers from the indigenous communities each month in the previous year for a total of six or more months will be presented with a medal.
2. Excellence Award: Businesses that have employed an additional three or more workers from the indigenous communities each month in the previous year for a total of six or more months will be presented with a certificate of merit.
Enterprises eligible for reward pursuant to these Regulations shall receive commendations from the central competent authority in charge of indigenous affairs.
These Regulations shall enter into force as of the date of promulgation.
